summary.para: The Microsoft AdControl provides everything that is necessary to display advertising in an app.
Instantiates an AdControl and provides the optional targeting parameters.

remarks.para: The AdControl is configured to show a new ad every 60 seconds. This is the default setting. If this behavior does not suit the app, you can set IsAutoRefreshEnabled to false and use the Refresh method to request that the AdControl show the next ad that is available.
Do not use the same instance of an AdControl across multiple pages.
Once set, the parent of the AdControl should not be changed.
All of the required properties on the AdControl need to be set before adding the control to a parent object. These required properties include AdUnitId and ApplicationId.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.AdControl.UseStaticAnchorRendererOption
member.summary: half of key value pair sent to renderer to tell it to use static anchor setup

member.name: F:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.AdControl.AdRotationTimeInSeconds
member.summary: Constant for Ad rotation time, currently is equal to one minute

member.name: F:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.AdControl.MinAdRefreshIntervalInSecondsMetered
member.summary: Constant for minimum Ad refresh interval when on metered network

member.name: F:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.AdControl.MinAdRefreshIntervalInSecondsUnmetered
member.summary: Constant for minimum Ad refresh interval when on unmetered network

member.summary: in multiple ad scenarios this tracks if any ad is engaged so that other ads on the same page do not refresh.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.AdControl.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new AdControl.

remarks.para: The developer must set the ApplicationId and AdUnitId properties before the app can show an ad.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.AdControl.Refresh

summary.para: A call to this method directs the AdControl to show the next ad as soon as an ad becomes available.
This method may not be used when IsAutoRefreshEnabled is set to true.

member.remarks: A new ad might not be available because of an error that occurred while trying to contact the ad platform.
member.exception: The IsAutoRefreshEnabled property is set to true.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.AdControl.AddAdTag(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Add an ad tag to the ad control. The maximum is 10 tags per ad control. If maximum is exceeded an errorOccurred event will be fired.
member.param: The name of the tag. Maximum of 16 characters, if exceeded an errorOccurred event will be fired.
The value of the tag. Maximum of 128 characters, if exceeded an errorOccurred event will be fired.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.AdControl.RemoveAdTag(System.String)
member.summary: Remove an ad tag from the ad control. This has no effect if the tag name does not exist.
member.param: The name of the tag to remove.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.AdControl.Suspend
member.summary: Suspends the current ad and replaces the current view of the ad with a snapshot of what was currently being rendered. If the ad was engaged, this action is cancelled and the expanded ad is closed. After calling Suspend the AdControl will not automatically refresh, if IsAutoRefreshEnabled=true, and you cannot manually refresh the AdControl until Resume has been called.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.AdControl.Suspend(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Suspends the current ad and replaces the current view of the ad with a snapshot of what was currently being rendered. After calling Suspend the AdControl will not automatically refresh, if IsAutoRefreshEnabled=true, and you cannot manually refresh the AdControl until Resume has been called.
member.param: If true and the ad was engaged, this action is cancelled and the expaned ad is closed. If false no action is taken on the expanded ad.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.AdControl.Resume
member.summary: Removes the static snapshot of the AdControl and replaces it with the dynamic display. Resumes automatic refresh of the AdControl, if IsAutoRefreshEnable=true, and allows manual refresh to occur again after Suspend.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.AdControl.InitializeAdSettings
member.summary: It shall initialized Ad personalized targeting settings data and register the settings commmand into app chime settings page.

member.summary: Helper method called from the event handler for the library notification of a new ad - used to make sure the new ad fits in the size available, and can be displayed by the ad control.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.AdControl.AdDownloadComplete(MicrosoftAdvertising.Shared.AdPlacement,MicrosoftAdvertising.Shared.AdException)
member.summary: Handle the AdDownload complete events

member.name: M:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.AdControl.UnloadAdControl
member.summary:
Release AdControl resources when AdControl is removed from the application page. This method detects whether this.Parent is null. If the parent is null, we need to clean up the AdControl.
The cleanup will only occur when the Parent is null, unless forceUnload is true. When the AdControl is being unloaded (see the AdControl_Unloaded event handler) we force cleanup even if Parent is not null.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.AdControl.ActivateAdControl
member.summary: Steps that need to happen when the ad control gets activated or comes in view

member.name: M:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.AdControl.DeactivateAdControl
member.summary: Steps that need to happen when the ad control gets deactivated or hides from view

member.name: M:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.AdControl.CheckIfRefreshIntervalMetAndRaiseError
member.summary: returns true if the minimum time between manual refresh has passed, this is 30 seconds when on an unmetered connection and 60 seconds on a metered connection, raises error if interval is not met

member.name: E:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.AdControl.ErrorOccurred
member.summary: Error event that is raised when the AdControl encounters an error while retrieving ads.

member.name: E:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.AdControl.AdRefreshed
member.summary: Event that is raised when the AdControl receives a new ad.

member.name: E:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.AdControl.IsEngagedChanged
member.summary: Event that is raised when the user clicks on the ad and the action dialog is waiting for input from the user.
member.remarks: This event is intended to give developers the option to pause the app when the action dialog appears.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.AdControl.Latitude
member.summary: The latitude of the user. Invalid values will be ignored.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.AdControl.Longitude
member.summary: The longitude of the user. Invalid values will be ignored.

summary.para: Gets or sets the ad unit identifier for this AdControl instance.
This value is provided to the publisher when the publisher creates an AdUnit in pubCenter. See the Publisher Onboarding Guide for more information.

remarks.para: Once set, this property cannot be modified.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.AdControl.ApplicationId
member.summary: The application ID of the app. This value is provided to you when you register the app with pubCenter.

remarks.para: Only one value for the application ID can be used within an app.
If more than one value for the ApplicationId is used in different AdControl objects that are in the app, some controls will not receive ads and will raise an ErrorOccurred event.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.AdControl.IsEngaged
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the user is currently interacting with one of the ads.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.AdControl.IsAutoRefreshEnabled
member.summary: Enables or disables the automatic refresh of ads. This property cannot be changed after the AdControl is added to a page.
member.remarks: This property can only be set when the AdControl is instantiated by using the default constructor or in XAML. Once set, this property cannot be modified later. This property is set to true by default.
member.exception: The IsAutoRefreshEnabled property has been set already.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.AdControl.IsPerformanceScrollingEnabled
member.summary: When true and the AdControl is in a scrollable container the current ad will temporarily be replaced by a snapshot image of the ad to improve scrolling performance. When the AdControl has stopped scrolling it will revert back to normal behaviour. When false no additional actions are performed on scolling.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.AdControl.UseStaticAnchor
member.summary: When true the internal WebView rendering the ad is replace with a static image of the current ad. When false the WebView is used to display the ad. Note that this value takes presidence over IsPerformanceScrollingEnabled

member.name: P:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.AdControl.IsSuspended
member.summary: Gets the current suspended state of the AdControl.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.AdControl.IsAnAdEngaged
member.summary: Internal property to expose whether any ad is engaged
member.remarks: This is exposed a property so dependencies can be tested via mock or stub

member.name: P:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.AdControl.IsPremiumInventory
member.summary: Whether this ad placement is reserved or long-tail inventory.

member.summary: displays the WebViewBrush and hides the WebView

member.summary: handles the AdInitialized event

member.name: M:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.AdvertisingWebBrowser.OnSizeChanged(System.Object,Windows.UI.Xaml.SizeChangedEventArgs)
member.summary: handles sized change events by applying the new size to the child controls

member.name: M:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.AdvertisingWebBrowser.RaiseAdLoadFailedEvent(System.String)
member.summary: Raises the ad load failed event to indicate that the ad did not load properly. This could be due to a timeout, problem loading the renderer, problem interacting with JavaScript using InvokeScript, etc.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.AdvertisingWebBrowser.RaiseRichMediaActionEvent(Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.RichMediaActionType)
member.summary: raises the rich media action event
member.param: the rich media action that occurred

member.name: M:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.AdvertisingWebBrowser.OrmmaRichMediaActionHandler(System.Object,Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.RichMediaEventArgs)
member.summary: This passes on any events raised in OrmmaImpl.

member.name: E:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.AdvertisingWebBrowser.RichMediaAction
member.summary: rich media actions

member.name: E:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.AdvertisingWebBrowser.AdLoadFailed
member.summary: event that is fired when an ad fails to load due to timeout or other error

member.name: E:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.AdvertisingWebBrowser.AdInitialized
member.summary: event that is fired when an ad is rendered

member.name: P:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.AdvertisingWebBrowser.CleanupOnUnload
member.summary: Controls the cleanup of the ormma instance, this is necessary since when expanding we're unloading and re-loading the webbrowser which triggers the unloaded event that would otherwise indicate that cleanup is required. This will be set to false in the loaded event to ensure cleanup unless explicitly disabled.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.AdvertisingWebBrowser.WebViewBrushUsage
member.summary: When true the currently rendered ad will temporarily be replaced by a snapshot image to improve scrolling performance. When the AdControl has stopped scrolling it will revert back to normal behaviour. When false no additional actions are performed on scolling.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.Constants
member.summary: Class containing shared constants.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.Constants.HiddenWhenShipped
member.summary: HiddenWhenShipped is used within DebuggerBrowsable attribute for all private/internal fields/properties of public classes to hide implementation details from app developers in Visual Studio's Watch window when debugging.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.JsFunctions
member.summary: constants which represent javascript function names used in ormma

member.summary: name of ormma parameters in string passed down form JS layer

member.name: T:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.OrmmaNetworkStates

member.summary: the action the event represents

member.name: T:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.ExpandProperties
member.summary: holds the container properties used during expand properties = { "width`*`" : "nn", "height`*`" : "nn", "useCustomClose`*`" : "true|false", "isModal`*`" : "true|false" (read-only), "lockOrientation" : "true|false", } see http://code.google.com/p/ormma/wiki/ORMMA_JavaScript#getExpandProperties

member.name: M:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.ExpandProperties.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: ExpandProperties constructor
member.param: choose whether to use custom close

member.name: P:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.ExpandProperties.Width
member.summary: the width of creative in pixels, default is full screen width

member.name: P:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.ExpandProperties.Height
member.summary: the height of creative in pixels, default is full screen height

member.name: P:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.ExpandProperties.UseCustomClose
member.summary: allows the ad designer to replace the default close graphic. True, stop showing the default close graphic and rely on ad creatives custom close indicator; false (default), container will display the default close graphic/

member.name: P:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.ExpandProperties.IsModal
member.summary: read-only property that identifies if the expanded container is modal or not. True, the SDK is providing a modal container for the expanded ad; false, the SDK is not providing a modal container for the expanded ad.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.ExpandProperties.LockOrientation
member.summary: Lock the orientation of the expansion, if it is not specified in the properties object a value of false is assumed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.OrmmaImpl.InitializeOrmma
member.summary: initialises ormma to a known state
member.returns: true if initialisation was successful, false otherwise

member.name: M:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.OrmmaImpl.Close
member.summary: changes the state of the rich media ad dependant on it's current state. default: moves to hidden resized: moves to default expanded: moves to default if it had expanded from default, moves to resized if it was expanded from resized hidden: no change

member.name: M:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.OrmmaImpl.Cleanup
member.summary: performs any required cleanup

member.name: M:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.OrmmaImpl.SetState(Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.RichMediaAdState)
member.summary: updates the state of ormma and keeps track of the previous state

member.name: M:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.OrmmaImpl.SetOrmmaAdContainerSize(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Sets the size of the ad container.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.OrmmaImpl.SetToPreviousState
member.summary: updates the state of ormma and keeps track of the previous state

member.name: M:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.OrmmaImpl.FireClickEvent
member.summary: firest the "click" event in the renderer, this is typically only fired when the developer has set UseStaticAnchor to true and allows us to notify the renderer that a user is interacting with the ad.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.OrmmaImpl.ProcessAdError(System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: processes the ad error message sent from ormma and raises the AdRenderError event, this will eventually raise the ErrorOccured event on the ad sdk.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.OrmmaImpl.SetUseCustomClose(System.String)
member.summary: sets whether to use close bands, SDK provided or a custom close button to exit full screen ad.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.OrmmaImpl.RaiseAdRenderedEvent
member.summary: raises the AdRendered event, this occurrs when the ad renderer sends a message telling us that they've finished downloading all assets etc

member.name: M:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.OrmmaImpl.RaiseAdInitializedEvent(System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: raises the AdInitialized event, this is a message sent by the bootstrap (ie us) to say we've set all parameters into the renderer and called init on it

member.name: M:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.OrmmaImpl.SetUserEngaged(System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: sets the background properties to use during expand
member.param: Dictionary containing required parameters (width,height,useCustomClose,lockOrientation) for expanding.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.OrmmaImpl.SetExpandProperties(System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: sets the background properties to use during expand
member.param: Dictionary containing required parameters (width,height,useCustomClose,lockOrientation) for expanding.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.OrmmaImpl.Expand(System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: expands the current ad to the specified size
member.param: Dictionary containing required parameters (url) for expanding.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.OrmmaImpl.Resize(System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: resizes the web browser to the size specified
member.param: Dictionary containing required parameters (height, width) for expanding

member.name: M:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.OrmmaImpl.Show
member.summary: shows the ad if it was in the hidden state

member.name: M:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.OrmmaImpl.Hide
member.summary: hides the add if it was in the default state.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.OrmmaImpl.SendSms(System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: Initiates an SmsComposeTask with data from the rich media ad.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.OrmmaImpl.SendEmail(System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: Initiates EmailComposeTask with data from the rich media ad.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.OrmmaImpl.StorePicture(System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: stores a picture to the devices media library
member.param: Dictionary containing required parameter (url) for making a call.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.OrmmaImpl.StartTiltAccelerometer(System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: updates the tilt value in the JS layer.
member.param: contains an optional parameter 'listener'. if 'start' it updates the the tilt value as it changes, if stop it stops updating, if not present it does nothing

member.name: M:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.OrmmaImpl.StartShakeAccelerometer(System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: Starts monitoring and sending the shake events to client.
member.param: contains an optional parameter 'listener'. if 'start' it updates the the shake value as it changes, if stop it stops updating, if not present does nothing

member.name: M:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.OrmmaImpl.SetupViewableChangedHandler(System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: Starts the monitoring if the ad is viewable or not
member.param: contains an optional parameter 'listener'. if 'start' it raises the the viewable changed event as it changes, if stop it stops raising the event.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.OrmmaImpl.OpenMap(System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: opens a map on a popup
member.param: contains parameters POI (point of interest) and fullscreen

member.name: M:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.OrmmaImpl.GetOrientation(System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: Updates the the web controls orientation variable or optional starts/stops listening for the orientation changed event.
member.param: contains an optional parameter 'listener'. if 'start' it updates the the orientation value as it changes, if stop it stops updating, if not present it updates the orientation once.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.OrmmaImpl.Resize(System.Double,System.Double,Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.RichMediaAdState)
member.summary: helper method for resizing, also updates state and size in the JS layer which triggers the appropriate events

member.name: M:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.OrmmaImpl.SetScreenSize
member.summary: sets the screensize to use in ormma in ormma

member.name: M:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.OrmmaImpl.RaiseRichMediaActionEvent(Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.RichMediaActionType)
member.summary: Fires an event if there are any handlers. Currently this is a no-op. We previously thought we might report to server when ormma was used to make a call or send sms. We do not do this now. This can be removed completely if it is determined we will never need this event.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.OrmmaImpl.DoRequest(System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: Issue request for the uri resource
member.param: dictionary of parameters. URL is the resource to request. Display is Ormma parameter to specify how to handle response

member.name: E:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.OrmmaImpl.RichMediaAction
member.summary: rich media actions, fired when user interacts with the ad

member.name: E:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.OrmmaImpl.AdRendered
member.summary: raised when we're notified by the renderer that the ad has been rendered, ie all assets etc have been downloaded

member.name: E:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.OrmmaImpl.AdInitialized
member.summary: raised when the bootstrap has finished initialising the renderer with parameters and init has been called on it. This is the event that will ultimately be used to notify the app that the ad has been refreshed.

member.name: E:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.OrmmaImpl.AdRenderError
member.summary: raised when ad renderer signals there was an issue rendering the ad, this eventually notifies the developer that there was an ad error and we invalidate the ad.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.OrmmaImpl.ExpandedCloseFunction
member.summary: method called when closed from expanded state this is typically a reference to a method on the WebBrowserView

member.name: P:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.OrmmaImpl.State
member.summary: returns the current state of the rich media ad (expanded, resized, hidden, default).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.OrmmaImpl.AdInstanceData
member.summary: stores the ad instances state, both in current instance and the exapnded instance

member.name: P:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.OrmmaImpl.CloseBandTotalHeight
member.summary: gets the height to use for close bands

member.name: M:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.OrmmaUtils.ValidateAndRemoveEmailList(System.String)
member.summary: parses a list of email addresses in a string separated by a ',' or a ';', validates them and removes them from the string if not valid or are duplicates. eg "test@example.com;test2.example.com,test3@example.com" would return "test@example.com;test3@example.com;"

member.name: M:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.OrmmaUtils.IsEmailValid(System.String)

member.summary: Show the popup

member.name: M:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.WebBrowserView.ClosePopup
member.summary: closes the popup and raises the closed event, if overridden it should be called after derived classes have performed their close task.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.WebBrowserView.PositionWebBrowser(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: positions the expanded browser in the popup, if the height or width is greater than the screen size the ad "...will be centered vertically and horizontally causing outlying areas to be cropped." as per http://code.google.com/p/ormma/wiki/ORMMA_JavaScript#expand

member.name: M:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.WebBrowserView.CloseButtonHandler(System.Object,Windows.UI.Xaml.Input.TappedRoutedEventArgs)

member.name: T:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.WebViewBrushUsage
member.summary: the WebViewBrush usage scenarios for the AdvertisingWebBrowser

member.name: F:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.WebViewBrushUsage.None
member.summary: never show the WebViewBrush

member.name: F:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.WebViewBrushUsage.DuringScrolling
member.summary: Show the WebViewBrush when scrolling/movement is detected, when movement stops and the LayoutUpdated event fires OR pointer movement is detected on the ad switch back in the WebView

member.name: F:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.WebViewBrushUsage.Always
member.summary: if the ad renderer has subscribed to the ormma click event, the WebViewBrush is shown always. Clicks on the WebViewBrush are passed through to the ad by raising the ormma click event.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Advertising.WinRT.UI.Win8TaskInvoker.errorReportCount
member.summary: used to prevent feedback loop to javascript layer, this scenario could happen when subscribing to the error event and in the handler for the error event you generate the same error again.
